Reviews.Title: “Glad we gave it a try!”
Reviews.Author: Lakeview5
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews here, my husband and I were hesitant to give this place a try but we were glad we did. We stayed in a ground floor efficiency with two double beds and a pull out sofa. The room number was 115. This room was on the corner of the hotel so we had a window on the end and the large door and window on the oceanfront. Upon arrival we found a large puddle in front of the refrigerator. After calling the front desk, they sent someone immediately who took care of that. We found no other issues with the room. We found our room to be small but certainly comfortable for the two of us. The bathroom was small but recently remodeled with new everything. The room had new curtains, bedspreads and carpeting. Nothing felt dirty except the tile floor where the puddle had been, but once the puddle was cleaned up, that too was taken care of. The room was quiet even with it being a corner room and the mattresses very comfortable. We enjoyed our stay here. We simply walked out of our room, around the corner and directly to the beach access. The beach was not crowded (this was the Wed and Thur before Labor Day) and being on the boardwalk provided us with a great place to walk without being to busy. Even though our room was on the ground floor, we had a view of the ocean (not the breaking waves). We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back; here are things to know”
Reviews.Author: carusta123
Reviews.Content: Three things, first I would go back. Second, this hotel does not have a changing room or even a bathroom that can be used by guests arriving early or staying after checkout. You are allowed to walk a block down to the Days In and use theirs, but this is not very convenient especially if you need to use a rest room. Lastly for the premiere room I had is was nice but the one TV (large flat screen) was in a cabinet facing the beds and could be seen from the “living room” area. We actually were able to move it ourselves to the top the cabinet to help somewhat (returning it before we left). But over all I was actually surprised and thought it was a nice place and a good deal great view (but get the 5th floor ocean front). Nice clean new bathroom, but sink very small. Also has a mini kitchen. Again for the money a good deal and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and dirty”
Reviews.Author: cohillnurse
Reviews.Content: Needed a last minute place to stay overnight. Many better hotels were booked and had little choice of picking this hotel. The room was outdated and was not clean. I checked beneath the headboard and noticed garbage, crumpled paper and a dead moth (not to mention that I saw a cockroach strolling by the check-in door). The place looked dirty! Was so nervous about the roaches that we slept with all the lights on! The location is very convenient. This is the only plus about the place. Would not recommend or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: cristina c
Reviews.Content: 3 friends and I took a random day trip up to Ocean City 8-27-12 and half way there called the Howard Johnson to book a room. Setting up the reservation was very easy and the person on the phone did mention that check in wouldnt be until 3 but we could get a parking pass while we wait. I arrived at the desk around 12ish and it was very simple to get the pass and the young man at the desk took down my number to alert me when i could check in. We went to Seacrets bar and grill while we waited. Awesome bar by the way. Guy called around 130 and said we could check in. Staff was very laid back and friendly. The room was spacious with a balcony, 2 beds, a pull out couch and a nice bathroom. Didnt have any complaints as far as the furniture being uncomfortable or any dirt so thats good. Went to the restaurant in the morning and they had very good food. the waitor was new but very friendly and fun. The hotel is also right on the beach and has a nice pool. Will return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “The manager Holly was very Helpfull !!”
Reviews.Author: RJGnavy
Reviews.Content: Couple of Glitches at the start but Holly made everything alright to our 110% satisifaction. I do believe that some circumstances can not be avoided so I give a rating based on how willing the staff is to try to correct issues and they did all they could which is more that some of the motel here.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bug feces”
Reviews.Author: gkatt
Reviews.Content: Thank god i did my usual hotel room check within a few hours of getting there! Mattress looked disgusting...wasn't sure what it was and manager and maids told me it was old. I checked out of the hotel after seeing 2nd room we were offered. Later talked to hotel pest control company and it was confirmed that mattress was caked in bed bug feces from prior infestation. Escalated complaint as high as possible w no satisfaction. Disgusting place w ignorant, uneducated, disinterested management and upper management!! I wish someone would have listed them on bed bug registry before my arrival since that's what i normally check before traveling.

Reviews.Title: “At least Oceanfront was accurate”
Reviews.Author: Zach T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 7/31/12 - 8/3/12. My girlfriend and I stayed in a premiere oceanfront room on the 5th floor. Overall the room was usable, but was not a good value for the money. I chose the Howard Johnson partially based off the name assuming there would be a higher quality standard than an independent hotel. The room was clean and odor free but there were several maintenance related issues that plagued our room, as well as a few other annoyances. First off none of the room doors worked correctly. The entrance door required a shove to open, similar to a break in seen on cops. The bathroom door also needed to be wedged and pushed into its frame to close. The sliding screen door did not slide very well to either open or close, it was quite frustrating to use. The main issue with the entrance door is that it does not seal out water when it rains. On the second day or our trip it rained for an hour or 2 and the first 4 feet of carpet inside the door became a soggy sponge, quite gross. Despite using towels to soak up some of the water the carpet was still damp when we left 2 days later. The bathroom was very, very small. The bathroom fixtures were updated and clean, but very small and no space to set anything down. The small kitchen counter space was nice and it was nice to have a small fridge and microwave. The balcony furniture was nice as well, 2 sturdy composite material chairs and a small table. Overall the hotel was not as updated as I would have expected from the 2011 renovations line of the description and the maintenance issues would make me avoid this hotel again. I know I did not choose to stay at the highest priced room in Ocean City, but I could have stayed elsewhere and received more for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Too Pricy”
Reviews.Author: Pamela B
Reviews.Content: I took my three teenagers for a short getaway from July 29 - 31, 2012. I booked it based on the location and the amenities. We stayed in a Deluxe Oceanfront room. The view was fabulous and the kitchenette was very nice as it has a microwave, refrigerator, convection oven and dinnerware. The bathroom is VERY small - tough if there are four of you. For the price we paid ($300+) the value was not good. I would recommend trying to go off season and hunt around for bargains. The room was really worth $160 - $180 maximum. Staff was nice but not over the top helpful or friendly. I am not sure I would go back again. I might try a different property

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: BBear64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Howard Johnson's Oceanfront Inn at 24th Street from May 13 to the 17th, 2012 and really enjoyed our stay. The clerk at check-in was very hospitable and there was a discrepancy about what was owed...they had a balance of $53.00 when I actually owed $159.00, so he checked us in and told us to come back in the morning and speak with the manager as to what is owed of which we did and the manager was very nice and handled the problem and everything was taken care of in a very professional manner. We got to stay in one of the newly remodeled pool view rooms which was located on the 1st floor and had a great view of the pool area. We had a private patio which was quite large and had two very nice Adirondack style chairs as well as a small table. The room was very spacious. The bed comfortable. however, quite high off the ground. The room itself was very clean. Loved the soft carpeting and the sofa was comfortable as well. The room also had a table with two chairs, adequate lighting, a nice fridge and microwave. And, also, a coffeemaker, as well as several packets of coffee. The bathroom was really nice. I loved the oversized shower which was great when helping with my special needs sister. It was very clean and the shower pressure was great and the on/off was very easy to operate as well as the hot/cold setting. There was a heat light and vent which both worked well. A beautiful seashell pedestal sink with huge mirror above as well as large mirror on the door. There was also storage cabinets on the walls, which provided great space to store everything. They also provided complimentary mouthwash, shampoo, conditioner, hand lotion and soap. Towels were plentiful, large and soft. The bathroom was also newly tiled as well. The only problem we had was the shower was quite slippery even though it does have have built in non-slip strips, I almost fell the first time I used it. The tiling also was rather slippery, but just put towels down over it and had no problem. The only other thing which wasn't a really big deal was that we did hear foot traffic from above, but nothing that was to the extent that it was disruptive and our entire stay we did not hear our neighbors on either side of us. The entire staff from manager to clerks to housekeeping and maintenance were all very nice and made our visit enjoyable. The price was very budget friendly. Also, the free coupon for the bucket of Thrasher French Fries was a great incentive...they were soooo good! I would stay here again and would not hesitate to tell our friends and family to give it a try as well!

Reviews.Title: “wasnt to bad,ive seen worse”
Reviews.Author: Mindy K
Reviews.Content: We stayes thwre for our honeymoon on 5/22/11 we didnt plan on going till the last minute.we got some good cash from the wedding.so we packed and left and looked for hotels on the way there.we call hj and we got a oceanfront room for about $100 a night.room was clean,but ac didnt work,but we didnt care cause that time of year is 70 deg.staff was fredly and said "congratlations" on the wedding and gave us afree coupon for thrashers fries.view was amazing at sunset and sunrise.leave the shade open in the morning and be welcome to a greatview of the sunrise.this isnt aplace for snotty rich people to appreciate,they should stay at the pprincess royale.nice place i recommend if your lokkinf for a cheap oceanview.sorry about thr misspellings via my nook.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Louise D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Howard Johnson with my family this past weekend (9/30-10/2) and had a great time! The front desk staff was very knowledgable about things to do on a rainy day. Very friendly staff! The bathrooms were updated, and there was plenty of room for 2 adults and 2 children in the room. I'm ready to book my stay for 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Yuk Avoid this Place”
Reviews.Author: Bob1216h
Reviews.Content: I should of listned to the reviews but since I wanted ocean front we got it. The view was nice , location was nice and peaceful close to end of board walk. Hotel is a different story place is filthy I mean almost everything, hotel lobby is tiny and check Inn is not hospitable, Elevator glass has not been cleaned in a long time very dirty , hallway floors very dirty , room size kinda small enough for us to get our things but bathroom was very small no place to put anything bathroom was clean because they just put in a new shower no tub but rugs in room are really filthy you can see dirty trail marks in bathroom from rug. we have been in discusting hotels before and this one is up there , we would never stay there again nor recommend anyone stay there and if you pay full price you will surely be disappointed . We did have some issues with our safe on two occasions and they did come right away to resolve problem. some of the pool cushions had very large dirt ball stains could be seen from above YUK

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the boardwalk.”
Reviews.Author: softballmom96
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Ocean City with four children, three 15 year olds and a 9 year old. The hotel was easy to find and the staff was very nice. Our room was an oceanfront and the view was beautiful. I liked that we were right on the boardwalk on the quiet end. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We had a microwave and fridge in the room. The package deal was a money saver. I will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: busman1100
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week. I was told it was an ocean front room.....yeah right! Get into the room, the door opens to a stoned area between HJ's and the next hotel, the patio door opens to the pool! Where was the ocean? Not to be found (at least to see). If we walked down 2 hallways, down a small set of steps and a walk up the ramp to the boardwalk....then we were ocean front! Room was small, not updated in a long time. We will not ever stay there again! eard there were bedbugs there, we did not have any problem with them at all. First couple of days pool was dirty, sand over the bottom, finaly Wednesday morning the pool was vacuumed. For what we paid per night could have stayed in a nicer hotel in Myrtle Beach cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, clean rooms, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Tour1252
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here with our 3 older children. It was a perfect location, still on the boardwalk but away from the craziness. Wish there was a little more to do closer by but its only a 15 minutes walk to a cute little outside bar along the boardwalk and the tram will easily take you to the pier for games and rides. Beautiful view from the private balcony, nice size rooms with a microwave and refrig, as well as glasses, cups and silverware. Room was clean although I wished the beds were queen sized instead of just doubles. Staff was very helpful and friendly! Pool was great with wonderful chaises all around for taking in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Mikef412
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Howard Johnson, 24th Street, just mediocre. The rugs were filthy; our white socks were black from walking around. The pool’s lounge chair mats were worn and in need of replacement. The blonde lady, who was some sort of a manager, was rude to guests and employees. One morning she was outside the office, poolside, screaming at employees to put a rollaway bed into a room. Ten minutes later, she’s at that room, to inspect whether it was put into the room. The hotel is way past its prime for the price they charge for the rooms. We will consider other accommodations next year.

Reviews.Title: “okay place to stay”
Reviews.Author: klees15mom
Reviews.Content: The first floor room overlooked the boardwalk, which was nice. The first morning, very early I might add, someone was BANGING on our sliding glass door and woke us up. When we answered the door, the man just walked away saying nothing !?! The a/c was okay, but could have been cooler. The bath was small, but functional. We had a frig and microwave, but didn't use them. We stayed a week, and when we needed clean towels, after the second and third day of using the same ones,we had to ask for them, along with rolls of toilet tissue. The room had NOT BEEN CLEANED and when we returned in the evening, our beds still weren't made . On the fourth day, the maid came in and we were sitting on the front patio, she asked "IF WE WANTED OUR ROOM CLEANED!" I said , "YES!!!!" so she looked around and obviously didn't see the sand we drug in and came back and asked "if we wanted our beds made too! DUH!?! I told her we also needed clean towels....when I came into the room, I found them laying on the bed, not hanging in the bathroom. She NEVER cleaned our room or bathroom, just picked up our dirty towels, made the bed (half) and left the towels. I thought daily housekeeping meant....DAILY CLEANING! We will not stay there again....we found cheaper hotels in the area that gave better service.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Hotel "EVER"”
Reviews.Author: caramani
Reviews.Content: When I first entered the room - "I wanted to run". Something was splatterd on the wall, the smell was bad, the a/c unit leaked, the bathroom was so so so small, the rug was damp (kept my shoes on). This hotel is not a clean hotel. Needs so much work. I don't mind old, but it was not clean. It was old and dirty! I saw one customer standing outside her room, due to the a/c unit leaking and it left a huge amount of water by their door.

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Worst Hotel For An Outrageous Price!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tamilee55
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day early for our vacation and needed to find a room for the night. This place offered us what they called "an ocean front suite"! The price was more than waht we wanted to spend ($400.00 for one night), but we thougth we would live it up a little with a nice room. Wow, were we in for a big surprise! First, there is only one evelator even for the maid service. So trying to get an evelvator can take a very long time. Then we finally get to our room and it was just nothing like we expected. The bathrooms were only big enough to fit one person at a time and even that was pushing it. There was a used bottle of mouthwash in the bathroom. That is just unacceptable and gross! The carpets were filthy. The air conditioner didn't really work and each room had it's own air conditioner over the door so outside was very noisy. There was a sleeper sofa but we pulled it out for our kids and I couldn't even kneel on it because it was so flimsy and it hurt. The beds in our so called suite were only double beds. My husband is 6'1" - He takes up a whole bed to himself. These are just a few of the many things wrong with this hotel!! I will never ever ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing from the start to finish due to their service”
Reviews.Author: Jen112344
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend anyone booking in advance to stay here. They tell you one thing and then when its time you get there and check in they give you what room they have left and tell you your reservation was for what they make of it and say thats what they had in their computer from your reservation. The service was very poor. The maid skipped our room two of the four days we stayed there. When we told them about it they said the maids left and there was nothing else they could do and to come down and get new towels. The manager was very rude when I checked in and told them they made a mistake with our reservation even after I showed him our confirmation number of what room we were supposed to have. Besides the hotel everything else was awesome the boardwalk, food and attractions were alot of fun especially the beach if I ever go again I will make sure I stay at a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Run the other way!”
Reviews.Author: Beachlax
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights for the Beach Lax lacrosse tournament. It was listed on the website so we thought it would be decent. The tournament sponsers shoul be ashamed to list it. The place is in dire need of renovation. The rooms are small and dirty. We woke up (0500) to no hot water the first day and when we brought this to the attention of the night clerk we were told in a sullen,ignorant, I don't care attitude that maintenence was aware of it but when it would be fixed he didn't know. No apology or concern for paying guests. Also found a moldy coffee packet in the coffee maker. Our room exited to an unclean alley. Day time staff was inexperienced and managers treated them rudely in front of guests. I wouldnT recommend this place to my worst enemy!

Reviews.Title: “Would rather sleep on the beach”
Reviews.Author: MaryGuers
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled when you walk into the lobby of the hotel, it is surprisingly nice compared to the hotel. We stayed here with two young children, and it was horrible. Dirty walls, carpet, bathroom...etc. Elevator brook many times... which is not fun when you are 8 months pregnant and have to walk up 3 flights of stairs with a toddler and suitcase in tow. I asked for some help, and was told someone would be by to help me... never happened. The only thing nice was that we had an ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “LOST BUT NOT FOUND!!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkElvisfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four days 8/20-8/24/09. Room was okay Bathroom was very small you couldn't even move in it!! Maid service was terrible had to get my own extra towels, asked for extra cups didn't get any and bathroom was clogged. On our way home (about an hour into the ride) my son realized he left his crucifix (cross) on the nightstand I called and the man at the front desk didn't even bother to go look in the room. He said that if they find it they would call me. I gave them an hour to look and when I called back the man again said that he did not find anything. I am sure the maid has it. Well GOD will punish her for taking the cross. Would not stay at this hotel ever again. Disappointed Family

Reviews.Title: “BIG DISAPPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: Bingersgirl
Reviews.Content: AC unit (mounted in wall above the room door) ran all night & day. Room seemed clean, but not very clean when you stayed there for more than an hour. The cabinetry around the small kitchenette area was literally falling apart w/nails exposed. In serious need of an upgrade & good cleaning. Only a few sodas in all the soda machine -when I told the front desk that they were really low in supply & that when you selected diet you got regular, they said they weren't refilling them since they close soon...nice service!! Crappy unmatching & dirty plastic furniture on the 1st FL (dirty) patio on the 1st floor. The Satellite restaurant is good food, but they also could use upgrading & customer service classes - the one waitress was not so friendly, ceiling leaked & would be better if workers wore bras when working there. Nice thing - location to boardwalk & ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Hotel with rude and unprofessional staff.”
Reviews.Author: applecyn
Reviews.Content: Guests Beware! Hotel is rundown and filthy. Rooms are moldy. Fire Alarm system malfunctioned 4 times within 24 hour period. Screeching ear piercing alarm (requiring fire department and police to deactivate) went off 8 am, 2 pm, 12:45 am and 1:30 am. Rooms had to be evacuated each time and parents stood in front of the hotel with crying babies in the middle of the night! Both day and night management were notified by numerous guests who requested compensation. When I asked if we would be compensated the manager told me "No". When I told him that I couldn't believe he wasn't going to apologize or explain, his reply was "you didn't ask for an explanation". The most unprofessional staff I have ever dealt with. Uncaring, rude, unfriendly. I currently have a complaint filed with Howard Johnson's.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better!”
Reviews.Author: FunWorldExplorer
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying at the Howard Johnson Oceanfront Inn in a Premier Oceanfront room on the 5th floor. (Please be aware when booking if you are reading reviews or looking at tours for the HJ Plaza -their best one, the Oceanfront Inn on 24th street or the HJ Express which is not on the ocean.) What we liked: Great view and small balcony, microwave, refrigerator, dishes; beds were comfortable, room seemed clean, parking convenient. Why we will never come back again: Overall seedy appearance- the public halls were very dirty, trash, spilled paint, looks like they have never been cleaned; bathroom very tiny with broken faucets and jacuzzi did not work; false fire alarms the first night at 1:30 and 2:30 am. Next time we will stay at the Hilton or Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel stay from HELL”
Reviews.Author: homeytc
Reviews.Content: Our trip started on 9/9/09 and we arrived at the hotel at 1:00 pm. The desk clerk was nice, we were given electronic keys for the rooms and we headed to room 311. The first appearance was the room was ok, it smelled clean and the beds looked good. We had issues with getting the sliding glass door open, as I call it; it took 2 men and a small boy to get the door open, but we did get it open. We had a nice view of the ocean. On 9/10 we laid our son down for a afternoon nap to have that interrupted by the fire alarm going off at 2:30 pm, which we had to leave the room until the Fire Dept cleared it for everyone to return to there rooms, for the most part we chalked it to things happen. On 9/11 we were awakened by the alarm going off again at 8:30 am, again we had to leave the room until the Fire Dept cleared it for everyone to return to there rooms. On 9/12 we again were awakened at 12:30 am to the fire alarm and once again we had to leave the room until the Fire Dept cleared it for everyone to return to there rooms. After getting our son back to sleep and ourselves we again were awakened by the fire alarm at about 1:15 am. By this point I’m passed pissed off, but what are you going to do. After we returned to our room our son is crying and does not want to stay here any more, after awhile I was able to calm him down so we could get him back to sleep. My wife had issues with something biting her legs and bottom while sleeping in her bed The floor was so dirty that we did not want our son playing on the floor. We found this out when he was wearing socks that the bottoms of them were black from the dirty carpet. There was water standing in the hallway in from of our friend’s room 406 that was at least 1 inch deep and about an area of 4 foot by 6 foot so every time we went to there room we had to walk through it. The elevator certificate we noticed was going to expire on 9/11/09 and this was on the first day we arrived and by Friday it still was not corrected. We did have issues with the elevator not going to the floor pressed on several occasions. While checking out there were several people that were very unhappy with they stay and the hotel clerk stated that they will do something for us, but he did not know what that might be, we asked who we should contact and he showed us the address of the last page of the bill. We still paid full price for our stay and I guess we will wait and see it they are interested in refunding any money’s or what they will or will not do. After checking out and we noticed that we were charged for the safe in the room at $1.50 per day not that it was going to put us in the poor house, but why are we charged for something we did not use or did we ask for. Overall I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I would rate our stay at 2 out of 10 or 1 star only because 0 stars is not a option.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: areyoupromise
Reviews.Content: I am writing this from our HoJo room at 2am. Why, you ask? Because for the fourth time today/tonight the fire alarm went off; a fire alarm that could only be turned off each time by the Ocean City Fire Department which took about 15 minutes each time. Maybe more. I don't know I'M TIRED. This started at 8am, occurred again around 2pm, and twice in a row around 1am. We were told it might have something to do with the rain. (They aren't equipped to handle rain?) The man at the front desk had ZERO sympathy as a woman with an autistic child, who would not get out of the car because of the alarm, asked for her money back and to be checked out. He told her that he couldn't give her a refund and that she would need to call whoever she booked the room with. He wouldn't give her a receipt or any proof of what had occurred. He told the group that had formed in the lobby that we would all have to wait to talk to the morning manager. As we talked to other guests we were told that some rooms smelled of mildew, were dripping with water, that pools of water had collected on carpets. Our room has an great view. That is the ONLY good thing I can think of to say. Before the alarm situation, the staff was unfriendly and unhelpful. The rooms are dingy. I can't even stand to walk on the carpet with my bare feet. And the WiFi doesn't reach everywhere. I am currently sitting on the floor next to our room door. My family has been trying to make the best out of the situation but we are at the end of our rope. Good luck to future guests. Don't bring any good expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at the right price and location.”
Reviews.Author: mondo_man
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the price. Great location, 24th Street on North end of boardwalk, if you want to be on the beach and close to stuff, but not in the thick of it (closer to 10th St would be really in the activity). We will try the 12th St HoJo next. Our Rooms came with mini fridge, sink, silver and dinnerware (was nice when we didn't go out for dinner on a rainy night). It was also nice to be able to open the door inbetween the 2 rooms. Skip the "coffe shop" its really a diner/greasy spoon...didn't eat there but the coffe was horrible. There's a nice coffe shop steps away on the BW. Nice parking lot in front, but can be alittle tight if you're driving a full size vehicle. Had some little problems (TV remote and key didn't work, and extra towels) that were resolved immediately by front desk and room service. Pool was nice when lifeguards closed beach...but wished the shower was closer to gate to rinse off sand. All-in-all a good bargain for a beach front property.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate stay in Howard Johnson Oceanfront 24th Street”
Reviews.Author: czang76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Howard Johnson on the Boardwalk at 24th Street Aug. 9 -14 in an oceanfront room on the 5th floor. I booked the rooms early and received a 25% discount. Had I paid the $299 regular rate for an oceanfront room I would have been somewhat disappointed. Like many Ocean City hotels, this is an older facility and I expected a smaller room with some dated features. However, the small bathrooms are updated with curved shower rods and newer appliances (an improvement over the yellow tiles at the Sahara). But, the water pressure in the shower was downright terrible. (I found myself missing the old style shower heads of the Sahara.) There is a newer kitchenette with a small sink, new microwave, toaster oven and fridge. This was one of the reasons we chose this hotel, and was a nice added feature. The location and view were great. The pool area is nice with adequate seating and a nice sized pool. I also liked being able to see the pool from my room and not have to walk across parking lots to get to it. Speaking of parking lots, no problems with parking and I liked that their lot is somewhat enclosed. No one can cut through the parking lot unless you are staying at the hotel. Now the downfalls...Overall, things were kept relatively clean, but not outstanding. The T.V. in our "deluxe" room was cracked and our remote had tape on the back (instead of a cover) to keep the batteries in place. Our air conditioning went out several times during the week and although a repairman came immediately to check on it, he basically told us that the units are old and they sometimes have problems with them. Other guests we spoke with had similar issues with their air conditioners. Sand built up all week around the outside shower by the pool; we never saw that area cleaned. We had to call the front desk at check in because our balcony chairs were covered in sand. I had to call the front desk again to have someone remove a half eaten sandwich that was in the hallway for 2 days. The maids were friendly, but unless you specifically asked them to clean something, you were given towels and a quick cleaning of the bathroom and nothing else. Overall, the Howard Johnson was fine but far from outstanding. It seems to be a common theme in Ocean City--disappointing to pay so much for a hotel room and then have to deal with lackluster facilities and service.

Reviews.Title: “Save Your Money”
Reviews.Author: ambdriv
Reviews.Content: Very poor parking. Spent a 1/2 hour trying to find a parking space. Once you find your space don't move your vehicle. We I complained at the front desk I was told "you can park at our other 1 block down the street." The hotel has only one VERY slow elevator. We sure got our exercise using the steps. The rooms are outdated. When we requested another set of towels it took an hour for us to recieive them. We were told the guy who delievers them was on his lunch break. No extra towels are kept behind the front desk. Staff is not friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, tired and in need of maintenance.”
Reviews.Author: webeach
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this motel since the mid-80s when it was still known as the Satellite Motel. Back then, it was family-owned and the service and maintenance was always rock-solid. It's probably been 12-15 years since it changed to a Howard Johnson's, and in that time, it has steadily declined in its level of maintenance, appearance and cleanliness. I've read that the Howard Johnson motel chain has scored near the bottom when it comes to the overall experience and this one is no exception. What does it have going for it? The location is right on the boardwalk at the quiet end on 24th street. You can't ask for a nicer spot for a family with children. You can take the boardwalk tram back from the busy end of the boardwalk and get off right in front of the motel. It has a nice pool and a parking lot adjacent to it. There is a miniature golf course and numerous restaurants within walking distance. There is an excellent restaurant for breakfast right in the motel. Now for the problems. We arrived during a heavy rainstorm after the check-in time and were informed that our room was not ready. A maid who was standing behind the check-in desk then informed the clerk that a room on a different floor was done, so the clerk gave us that room instead. When we got to the room, it was not done, and the maid was just starting to clean it at the time. We walked to the end of the floor where we could look out at the beach while the maid completed her work. The walkway had empty plastic bags, assorted trash, and a toilet plunger laying about. The bag was not picked up for two days. When we returned to the room we found it to be adequately clean but very worn. There was a hole in the wall near the bed and our daughter would not sleep on the side of the bed near it for fear a rodent would come through it as she slept. My wife turned the hot water on at the sink and the handle came off in her hand because the screw holding it on was missing. The sofa had torn cloth coming off at the bottom and the upholstery on the chair seat at the table was ripped. There were holes in the wall at both ends of the shower. At one point, I noticed ants crawling on the combination drawer and TV stand. My daughter asked me why all of the people who worked there were so unfriendly. The second evening we were there we ran into a woman who was removing her bags at 6:00. When I asked her if she was checking out late, she told me that she and her traveling companion had just checked in but they were now leaving the motel. When I asked why she said that the floor in her room was wet and the room smelled of mildew. Apparently the room had flooded during the heavy rain the night before. When we checked out at the end of our stay we overheard a woman telling the desk clerk that there was mold on the walls of her room. In our entire four day stay, the animated part of the motel sign along the street was stuck so that jibberish was all it displayed. No one bothered to fix it or at least turn it off. Just another example of what appears to be a disinterested management style. We decided on the way home that we'll look for a different place to stay when we return to Ocean City. At the price they charge, this place should be in better condition. It's sad that what once was a nice motel has been allowed to deteriorate to this level.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience of my Life”
Reviews.Author: jmm5000
Reviews.Content: First impression: Room was small. Bathroom was designed such that turning on the shower instantly flooded the floor, which never dried. However, the worst was yet to come. The fire sprinkler system went on the fritz and activated in our room, soaking the carpet and several of our clothes bags with mildew-smelling water. Our room opened to the outside near a steel staircase; the outdoor sprinkler system made a puddle of water at the top of the staircase, making them incredibly slippery. One full day after the sprinkler incident, the puddle was still there and the stairs were still wet. I slipped and fell down the stairs while carrying bags out of the room. The hotel's response to this entire situation was mind-boggling. -The manager would not move us to a dry room or to the other Howard Johnson. -When pressed by all four in our group, the manager initially agreed to compensate our entire stay. 20 minutes later, when we tried to get our refund, he outright lied and claimed that he never offerred to compensate us. He then claimed that he would charge us for only one night, but flatly refused to produce any receipt or to make the offer in writing. In reality, he did nothing. - At checkout, when the manager still refused to work with us, our group called the corporate offices to complain. At this point, the manager CALLED THE POLICE TO HAVE US REMOVED FROM THE PROPERTY. We had not raised our voices, we had not been threatening at all. Our group was four medical students who had been model guests. THE MANAGER ACTUALLY CALLED THE POLICE TO HAVE US REMOVED FROM THE PROPERTY SIMPLY BECAUSE WE COMPLAINED ABOUT THE SERVICE. This hotel ruined our vacation. The stay was unpleasant, the room was disgusting, and it was absolutely humiliating to be treated like criminals when we wouldn't kiss the manager's feet. STAY AWAY. STAY FAAAAR AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for family...”
Reviews.Author: garza007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great combination of value and location. Obviously, this facility is not 4 star, but we understood this when we booked the room. The hotel is located right on the boardwalk and the beach. We had an ocean front room that had a great view and was reasonably priced compared to others in the area. The room was not spotless but relatively clean for a beach motel. We had a deluxe room with two doubles and a sofa sleeper which worked well for our family of five. No continental breakfast, but we can prepared with cereal and morning pastries. We were also able to eat well for lunch in the room since it came equipped with a half-size fridge, sink, microwave, & toaster oven which we used for small french toast pizzas. The hotel was right next to local stores such as Sunsations and the Candy Kitchen and very convenient to the bus line ($2/day per person -- all you can ride). The pool was small but had a shower facility to wash off the sand after hitting the beach. Overall, the room was a great value and would definitely recommend as long as you are not expecting high class facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good only for a night and with low expectations”
Reviews.Author: queenbee19
Reviews.Content: Ocean City was the last stop of a long road trip. Desperate to find a place for one night, I booked at this location (not to be confused with the one located more downtown). I had very low expectations going in. That being said, it's good enough for one night. Do not go here expecting anything and it suffices. The hotel location is its best asset. Along the boardwalk and within walking distance of restaurants, activities, souvenir shops, and such. I highly recommend Higgin's Crab House and Happy Pancake House, both within walking distance. The front desk was fine, no complaints. I did overhear the employees talking on their walkie-talkies about one client complaining about a hole in the wall?! This def made me nervous. We opted for a room facing the swimming pool. The hallways seem damp, dark and dirty. It is not an inviting walk to the room. The room itself was sufficient. It wasn't clean enough for me to walk around without my flip-flops on, but there was nothing outwardly dirty about the room, either. I laid out towels along the bathroom floor. The sink has absolutely no space around it, so I had to leave all my toiletries on the other side of the room. The water pressure was fine and they provided toiletries. The TV had many channels and the internet was free. The beds were comfortable enough. I had asked for a king, but I got 2 double beds. I tossed off the top cover and just used the sheets. I left the curtains closed the entire time, as it was very easy to see directly into our room. There is also a safe - please be aware that they charge you an additional $1.50 for using it. Upon check out, make sure to ask for that refunded. There is also a fridge and a microwave. The fridge did come in handy for our leftovers. Please do not stay here more than a night or two. It is a good place if you are passing by, but if you need to stay in OC longer, I highly recommend renting a condo. Sometimes it is much cheaper than staying in hotels, and you get more space, comfort, full kitchen, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Weekend”
Reviews.Author: aldkyk
Reviews.Content: We went to the Howard Johnson for a birthday celebration for a friend. I can't say too much about the value of the hotel during peak season, but we got a block of rooms and the rate was only $60 per night which was a great deal. I would not recomment staying at this hotel for more than a few days. This is mainly because it is a pretty standard hotel room. Anyone staying for longer might require the use of a kitchenette, and there are many other places to stay in the area that provides this. The beds were very comfortable, and the microwave and small refrigerator were great. The front desk staff could have been a little bit more friendly and helpful. I requested a later check-out time the night before and was told that I would have to call the next morning. Of course to do this I had to wake up early anyway, so we just checked out at the regular time.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be confused with Howard Johnson "Plaza"”
Reviews.Author: Ariel.T.
Reviews.Content: It has been a few years since we've stayed at the How. John. Oceanfront on 24th Street... I've noticed some writers are giving their review for the Ho Jo's on 12th Street. That is not this hotel. That is the How. Johnson "Plaza".. Anyway, not much seems to have changed in the past 4 years... Our room was very small, but nicely equipped and cleaned "very well" by our fantastic housekeeper. She was a sweetheart.. She took pity on us, after the people staying in the room above us caused some kind of overflow in their toilet.. After several calls to the front desk to tell them there was chaos going on in the room above us, (it was 2am at this point) and that it sounded like they were jumping up & down in the bathroom, a leak of water and brown runny stuff came threw our ceiling in the bathroom.. The "boy" at the front desk simply asked, "what would u like me to do about it?" Two minutes later we saw the people who were staying above us, coming from the office with a plunger.. They did not move us to another room.. Our housekeeper came in & cleaned our bathroom from top to bottom.. The pool was ok but not heated and was full of sand & "yuck".. The location was great, right on the boardwalk so we were basically on the beach, but far enough from all the rides & games on the boardwalk, that it felt relaxing. The Satelite Diner downstairs was great! The food is good, the coffee is good, and the staff is excellent. There is always a line to get in.. We have been back to OC several years now and we always try to have a breakfast at the Satelite (even though we have never stayed at this How. Johnson again)..

Reviews.Title: “Great location; but some work to do!”
Reviews.Author: Traveldanse
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location on quiet end of boardwalk with very nice private oceanfront balcony (would not have stayed in anything but at this hotel...) Front desk service rude, uninformed and lazy. (However, we noticed that at many OC businesses...and mind you, I used to live in the area many years ago, and I don't recall it being that bad...) Remote control didn't work to TV and they came up 3 times to fix it before it worked. (At least maintenance guys were the nicest of the staff.) Nice beds, but ill fitting bottom sheets, and sheets never changed in 5 night stay. Place starting to show some wear and tear (stained carpets, rust, dirty walls) but had all the basic amenities like fridge, microwave, pool, hot tub....) Housekeeping forgot coffee twice, but did ok job, even if their timing was never right. Though I requested an upper floor room, they gave me first floor but were able to move me the next day to 4th floor, making all the difference in the world. The first floor room we had originally was right by the elevator and ice and soda machines, hence, very loud, the bathroom was microscopic, and we did not feel safe sleeping with balcony open to hear the waves, which you could do on the upper floors. (Though at sunrise, the gulls start screeching and one night there was a drunken fool shouting and cussing at the top of his lungs at 3:30 am until I yelled at him to "shut up" after 10 minutes of his tirade keeping me (and others) up... Overall stay was ok and we're glad we made the trip. Was great to be back at OC and the lower Del beaches and the boardwalks, the great food- weather was fantastic until Tropical Storm Hanna became slightly annoying..Seeing the dolphins again was cool, rode the tram, shopped the shops....big lunch at Phillips-mmmmmm

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: par_rl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was GREAT! Very apperant renovations were recent. New carpet in halls and room, new bathroom tiles, fixtures, clean room and nice flat screen TVs. A nice, clean, updated feel. The location was perfect and the staff was very helpful and friendly. We got there early and couldn't check in, but they gave is a parking pass and we went to the beach. Location, location, location for fun on the beach and at the board walk. The pools are small, but we were there for the beach, not the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: kbelz316
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was located right on the boardwalk and it seemed pretty nice and affordable. On a website for OCMD the only offer for making reservations online was for "best available." After calling the hotel they explained to me that BEST AVAILABLE meant we were to get the room best available at the time we placed our online deposit. that could be from a standard no view room or an ocean front room. After placing the deposit I called back to see what we were assigned and were told ocean front with 2 double beds. Little did I know I got the crappiest room, next to a dumpster with a 5 foot distance from our room the next next building, with NO view. The people at the desk were RUDE and immature. The manager was not accommodating at all either. What also was not pleasant was the ants and moths in our room!!! Along with a broken air conditioner and the replacement made one side of the room freezing and the other 85 degrees. The service we got was horrible and we got scammed with their best available promotion. Its a lie and i would never recommend this hotel to anyone!!! DISGUSTING

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: rssej
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be right on the boardwalk with easy access to the beach and boardwalk attractions. We were! The room was clean and recently updated. The beds were very comfortable. Even though we were there on a sold-out weekend the staff was courteous and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “It's a place to place your head.”
Reviews.Author: blade35
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 7/7-7/11. The bathrooms/sink are small, but it's not the end of the world. The room was very nice and clean when we arrived. The bathroom had some rust spots, but it's not a big deal. Rooms were cleaned very quickly except for our last day. We had a balcony on the boardwalk, which had a great view. My wife and I loved sitting on the balcony at night. Most of the staff are uninspiring and seem like they don't care. No big deal to me. It's just nice to hear "Good morning" or "Have a nice day" every now and then or just even to smile. Pool is a nice size and my wife enjoyed it. We didn't eat at the cafe, but it looked nice. It's a nice place to stay at the end of the boardwalk. I've been to better and worst in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Howard Johnson Oceanfront Plaza”
Reviews.Author: wcsd4090
Reviews.Content: Just stayed the July 4th weekend at the Ho-Jo's on 12th St in Ocean City, MD. It was okay, great location and nice rooms with a flat screen TV on the wall. The problem was the air system in the room was very loud. Every time it kicked on or off, it woke me up. The indoor and outdoor pools were nice but very small. They only had 4 carts for people to use for luggage which made for some heavy carrying out to the car.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: brneyedgirl012
Reviews.Content: We checked in on June 26, 2008. We were on the 5th floor. The bathroom was clean, but there is NO place to put any of the things you brought along with you for showering. we had to put all our bathroom supplies on top of the microwave or on top of the countertop where the microwave was sitting at. Bathroom sink was the smallest sink I had ever seen. The bed area was clean and the view of the ocean was GREAT! we had 2 adults and 2 children on our stay, and we only had 3 small drawyers to put our clothes in The chair on the balcony was broke, and they did replace it. The first night we stayed there was Thursday and it was quiet, and very realxing! However, Friday evening, I honestly believe thay had nothing but partying in that building!! The guys beside us, sounded like they had brought a stereo from home and it was loud the whole stay!! They were screaming, hitting the walls, slamming doors and on the balcony using profanity. We called the front desk 3 times on different days about this, it would stop, and than couple hours later they were back at it again. we were told they were going to send security up, but apparently that never happened. We slept every night with our sliding glass door open, so the sounds of the ocean would drown out the neighbors noise beside us!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience...”
Reviews.Author: Mayzie73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this motel for a long weekend. To start with the positives, the staff was friendly and accommodating; the room had new carpet and was clean and there was a nice view of the ocean. On the negative side, the bathroom was not very clean, there was never any hot water in the shower (the best you could get was lukewarm water that only lasted about 5 minutes), the bedding had a very musty odor and the tv was not in very good working order (the far left side of the screen was all yellow and the far right was purple). The room was okay; we knew it would not be a top of the line room when we booked it but it still fell below our expectations. Also, if you book a room here you may want to request a room away from the elevator. It makes a very loud dinging sound when it stops on the floor and it can get a bit annoying if your room is outside of the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcjeremy05
Reviews.Content: My friends and i stayed at the howard johnson this september. the room was very clean and spacious. The view from our oceanfront balcony was breath taking, the pool was roomy and clean. the hot tub was a little to hot. the only complaint i have is we had a keep asking for towels. other than that i would definently stay here again. also the hotel is located right on the beach with a resturant in the lobby area. And for the price of 180 a night it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Its a place to stay , like many others.”
Reviews.Author: Jerzejoe1
Reviews.Content: Location is good. Motel is clean. Its a little loud bike week, but what the hell. The restaurant is good, also. The pool (when I was there), was clean and warm. I was in it for hours. I personally like a motel a little closer to the action, but not to close. I would reccomend this place to poeple I like.

Reviews.Title: “Howard Johnson Much better then anticipated”
Reviews.Author: Hey10
Reviews.Content: The Howard Johnson overall was a very nice hotel. The room was updated with newer carpet and bedding, and everything was clean. The bathroom could have been a bit cleaner, then again I am very picky. The pool was a nice size and was cleaned daily, but the hot tub was not working properly and wasnt cleaned. The maid service could have been better had to call to the front desk for some things because the maid could not understand plain english. Overall I would stay there again of course if the price is right and $85 dollars a night in June was for the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “NO Pool, like advertised”
Reviews.Author: skippybuzz
Reviews.Content: There is no working pool.... was being drained and painted. No compensation given for no pool. No sheets given for sofa bed. No clean towels on day 2. Always had to go to front desk for linens.

Reviews.Title: “OMG!!! This Trip Was GREAT...”
Reviews.Author: vanillablonde44
Reviews.Content: I was VERY Happy.... The room was a deluxe room and it was on the 5th floor and when me and my children walked in the room it was BREATH TAKING :-) Nice clean room, Ac worked great, a private balcony over looking the boardwalk and ocean, bathroom was all fresh and clean, kitchen had microwave and a toster oven, clean dishes, glasses, silverware.. the sliding glass doors had a screen and we loved hearing the ocean all night and day long.This was the first time my 2 teens have ever been to the Ocean and we had a 3 night stay and it turned into a 5 night stay and we were able to keep booking the same room.The staff was kind and pleasant and made our vaction a wonderful experience... I would recommend This Hotel To Anyone who is planning a trip to ocean city maryland. . ps we had room 509 (*_*)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Jyoti05
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the horrible reviews about the Howard Johnsons in O.C. I was very anxious about staying there. I thought that we were going to pull up to a "dump", but we were pleasantly surprised. I booked our trip online and requested an oceanfront room which we received no problems. Other guests that had written reviews relayed their dismay on getting there and not having their oceanfront rooms available...we did not have this problem. The view from our room was breathtaking. We had an end room, so not only did we have a balcony, but we also had a side window that could view the ocean when sitting at the table. Absolutely beautiful! We had no complaints on the cleanliness of the hotel or the pool. All seemed to be very well taken care of. The sliding balcony doors also had a screen door so we kept that open all night and let the sound of the ocean drift us off to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again.”
Reviews.Author: Blueheart
Reviews.Content: We planned to visit with my in-laws who had arrived on Thurs.in the same HJ. My husband & children ages 2 & 4. We arrived at the same time that Ernesto (storm) did. The young lady at the time we arrived was very nice to give us some suggestions of things to do in the rain w/small children. Things quickly went down hill from there. Ernesto came in ernest and basically shut down most everything. As we watched the ocean get closer & closer to the boardwalk ( right out side of our window) I called concerned if we would all have to leave ocean city. Eventually my children were afraid and wanted to go home. I inquired about the possibility of getting any of the $261 for one night, refunded to me. ( we had only been there a couple of hours). I was advised that the manager advised there would be no refunds. Apparently others had also become concerned.We decided to stick it out. In the meantime we had water bubbles (huge) filled with water leaking in the room in several places. The carpet was wet etc. We were moved to another room, which was also leaking. It had not been cleaned properly and there was food from prior customers in the fridge. The elevator also stopped working. I spoke to the person at the desk and she advised I would need to speak to the manager in the am. In the am I again asked for some type of refund for the wet rooms & other issues. Then I was advised that the general manager had the nerve to say all of the hotels in OC probably had leaks ( not true, also had friends staying in other hotels and they were DRY) that shouldn't matter, we were customers at HJ and we had to pull the love seat to block part of the room to keep our children from getting wet.No refund no apology ,nothing. I will be writing to Howard Johnson owners. I would never stay here again. Only good for partying teen-agers who don't care about conditions or good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “we really liked staying there”
Reviews.Author: net85
Reviews.Content: We went there on a bus trip an it was wonderful we were on the first floor an the beach was right out our back door an the pool was right out our front door ...it was perfect very convient and also the room was very clean...would stay there again for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Expected the Worse - Got The Best”
Reviews.Author: ghodill
Reviews.Content: I'll admit we were worried after reading all the negative reviews from 2005. However, Our experience at the HoJo's was great. Our Ocean Front room, on the 5th floor, was immaculate when we arrived. Everything looked brand new, including the Bath and kitchen area. We experienced none of the problems described in the past reviews from 2005 and didn't see a bug our whole stay. The room served 6 of us well - yep 6, which admitedly was a bit crowed but it worked. The staff from Jennifer, John, Jane and the rest couldn't have been nicer - and, we had no problem understanding any of them. Plus, we had MIA, the best room maid ever. We can't say enough about the staff. If I wanted to nit pick, yes the parking lot is crowed, yes,the Omni stone pathway makes your lugage fall off your cart sometimes - but this was our vacation, and we were able to overlook the small stuff and really enjoy the great view from our room, the Boardwalk location, and the great hospitality HJ's is famous for. Thanks for a great week. Family from Pittsburgh PA

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: Sultaness
Reviews.Content: Beautiful oceanfront view with added plus of a very clean and pretty room, including updated bathroom fixtures, kitchen appliances and furniture. Everything was comfortable and in great shape. Loved the kitchenette with microwave, fridge, sink, and coffee maker, including dishes and utensils. Parking was easy and we were allowed to stay parked the rest of the day after our 11AM checkout time. Nice location near bike rentals --and a great adjacent coffee shop. The boardwalk was nice and quiet during sleeping hours - we kept our sliding glass door open all night long to enjoy the ocean sounds! Office folks were helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I paid good money for this hotel, and it wans't worth a cent of it. The people were as rude as can be. We arrived early and asked for a early check in, well our room was the last one to be done, we did not get in our room until well after check in time. Then when we went into our room, they were still cleaning it. The molding around our door was missing so there was actually insulating sticking out of the wall. Our bathroom door wouldn't not shut. When we asked for something to be fixed, they were to busy. The service was terrible, and the room was terrible. Take my advice and do not waste you money.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: dave101
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I ever stayed at and it is not worth one cent first of all when I got my room I turn on the AC it made a horrible sound the palce had a horrible smell and the Bathroom was small after I took my shower I went to pick up a bath towel it was durty. The swiming pool was not that grate it only went up to 6Ft and it was very small. The worst thing was the cleaness of the room I would give this hotel a 1 out of 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nightmare. It is absolutely filthy. The shower had black scum in it and the maids never cleaned the bathroom or the floor. They just replaced towels. Screws were sticking through the ceiling and the walls. The kitchen utensils were filthy and thrown in a tray under the bottom of the filthy sink. We were afraid to reach under there. The toaster oven was so filthy and rusted that we couldn't use it. Water continuously dripped on your head out of the air conditioner over the front door. WE did not have a screen on the balcony. The couch was full of sand when we checked in. The jacuzzi near the pool was so green that no one went near it. WE had three rooms for all our family members. We were all miserable. Everyone of the rooms were terrible. The phone in my sisters room didn't even work. She told them three times - no one came. We were never given toilet paper. We had to ask every time. The people at the front desk were terrible. They either didn't know what you were saying or didn't care. There are a lot of nice places to stay at the beach - this is defintely not one of them. You will certainly feel like you wasted your money. And it was not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi I rented a suite at this hotel in 24 th street in Oc I will never stay there again.The problem is that the carpet in the room and on the balcony was always wet.The carpets on the entrance of all the balcony;s are soaked from the condensate from the airconditioners .The room I stayed in had the wires for a smoke detector but there was none it was ripped out. there was sheetrock screws popped from the ceiling there was no screen on the patio door plus it took 2 people to open it up.The cabinet doors were screwed on with sheetrock screws and you couldnt open them to get any of the untinsels that were supposed to be available.The front of the sink fell off and hit my wife on the foot when my neice shut the front door.The shower had black soap scum on it as well .Man I hate hotel bathrooms.We even had to get our own toilet paper.When you take your luggage in you have to roll over all these bricks and everything falls off the carts continuously and the walkways are uneven on the upper floors and that kncks off all your stuff.Believe me I have stayed in a ton of hotels at the ocean but man this is the worst ,plus the front desk no one can understand you they are all from some where else.All I can say is think twice before you stay there .

Reviews.Title: “No smoking rooms a hoax”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room accomadations were Okay but we were supposed to be in a non-smoking room and the room reaked of smoke! You could smell strong smoke odors in the room as if someone was smoking next door and the smoke was filtering in our room. All of the rooms in that area were supposed to be non-smoking. All our clothes had to be washed when we returned home because of the strong smell. I know you can not control children but at 1 or 2 in the morning we could hear adults and childrens talking loudly from the room above us.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a terrible stay here. The beds are old and not firm. They can't seem to afford fitted sheets and the bed sheets they do use don't fit so they are always coming off the bed as soon as you sit down. A hugh cockroach crawled over me in the evening waking me from my sleep. The television is missing 'knobs' and the remote's batteries were dead. The front desk service was terribly slow, with even the simplest of tasks, and the staff clearly could care less. The bathroom door jammed every time it was shut and then one is locked in the bathroom until someone from outside the bathroom helps push the door open again. The sliding glass door screen didn't work, again it took at least two hands to open and close it. The carpet was dirty and the couch was old and not clean. The water pressure in the shower was very low. Terrible and unclean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gets worse every year”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rates are good for the location and ammenities but this is the 2nd year we stayed here and it just gets worse. In 2002 there were stains on the comforter (looked like blood) and not very clean. In 2003 we had to wait to check in so the room could be cleaned. When we got to the room there were feces and paper clogged/waterlogged in the toilet, the sink was dirty, the table was sticky and excessive dust on the tv hutch, there was no toilet paper left (we had to dash into the storage room to get some), the maid took our wash rags but didn't leave any because the she didn't have any at that time and our room was ignored one day even though we saw the maid cleaning the room next to us-she never came to ours to do trash or linens or anything (we even left the room for 1/2 hour so she would do it but was gone when we returned).

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Oceanfront Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: On the Boardwalk at 24th Street, Ocean City, MD 21842
